api.services

Class AccountAuthService

  • java.lang.Object
    • api.services.AccountAuthService

  • @Service
public class AccountAuthService
extends java.lang.Object
    Service to facilitate storing required authentication details for Accounts (passwords and tokens) on a per session basis in memory.
    Author:
    mattgogerly

    • Method Detail

      • addAccount

        public void addAccount(java.lang.String key,
                       java.lang.String password)
        Adds an Account to the authentication storage mapping.
        Parameters:
        key - Id of the Account
        password - Password or token for the Account

      • deleteAccount

        public void deleteAccount(java.lang.String key)
        Deletes an Account from all storage mappings.
        Parameters:
        key - Id of the Account to remove

      • getPassword

        java.lang.String getPassword(java.lang.String key)
        Gets the password or refresh token for an Account.
        Parameters:
        key - Id of the Account
        Returns:
        Password or refresh token, or null if it has not been added

      • addStore

        void addStore(java.lang.String accountId,
              javax.mail.Store store)
        Adds a JavaMail Store object to the store storage mapping. We want to reuse these as reconnecting for every operation is expensive and can cause rate limiting.
        Parameters:
        accountId - Id of the Account
        store - Store to be added

      • getStore

        javax.mail.Store getStore(java.lang.String accountId)
        Get the Store associated with an Account.
        Parameters:
        accountId - Id of the Account
        Returns:
        Store if it exists, null otherwise

      • addSession

        void addSession(java.lang.String accountId,
                javax.mail.Session session)
        Adds a JavaMail Session object to the session storage mapping. We want to reuse these as reconnecting for every operation is expensive and can cause rate limiting.
        Parameters:
        accountId - Id of the Account
        session - Session to be added

      • getSession

        javax.mail.Session getSession(java.lang.String accountId)
        Get the Session associated with an Account.
        Parameters:
        accountId - Id of the Account
        Returns:
        Session if it exists, null otherwise

      • refreshOAuth

        java.lang.String refreshOAuth(java.lang.String refreshToken)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Google OAuth tokens (for Gmail) expire after 3600 seconds (1 hour). We therefore need to use the refresh token to get a new access token when the old one expires. We store the refresh token rather than the access token or password and simply request a new access token whenever we need one.
        Parameters:
        refreshToken - The refresh token for an Account
        Returns:
        Access token valid for 3600 seconds
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the request fails
